thread.title: NOPD believes guns confiscated in officer-involved shooting rela
thread.title_full: NOPD believes guns confiscated in officer-involved shooting rela - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: NOPD believes guns confiscated in officer-involved shooting rela
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - The New Orleans Police Department's Public Integrity Bureau is reviewing the case of an officer shooting a suspect.
Police responded to a call about suspicious men armed with guns in the 2200 block of Desire Street around on Sunday around 3 p.m.
Police said one of the men shot at the officers when they arrived. They returned fire and shot the man in the buttocks. He was taken to a hospital for treatment.
The other man ran away from the scene, according to the NOPD.
No officers were injured.
The officer involved in the shooting is Jacob Lundy. He has been on the force for eight years.
The NOPD reassigned him while the incident is under investigation.
The suspect who was shot by police is Albert Fountain, 32. He is recovering in the hospital from the gunshot wound. Police will book him with attempted first-degree murder of a police officer and illegal possession of a firearm.
Johnson was also booked with illegal possession of a stolen weapon after police say they found a stolen revolved in his possession.
Other items recovered from the scene include:
.45 caliber semi-automatic handgun (on the suspect) .40 caliber magazine (near the suspect) 9MM sub machine gun with an extended magazine (under the house) 12 gauge shotgun (under the house) Stolen revolver (inside the house) 100 round drum of ammunition (inside the house) Cash (inside the house) Narcotics (inside the house) Evidence related to string of armed robberies reported in the 5th District (inside the house) A silver 4 door Camry, which was reported stolen from a carjacking in the 2200 block of Marais Street on Sept. 29. The NOPD believes some of the evidence recovered from the scene might have been used in several armed robberies and attempted armed robberies in the Fifth District.
